alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 27 at 3:08PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF SE ALASKA FOR THE WEEKEND... A storm force low and front move into the AK Gulf from the W early Saturday before weakening as it moves eastward by Sunday. The low is now expected to mainly impact the AK Gulf as it should not cross over the panhandle but remain over the gulf while weakening. Strong winds with gust of 40 to 50 mph will impact the northeast gulf coast and central panhandle Saturday. As the low tracks east the secondary wrap will shift winds to the SW and increase over the southern panhandle Sunday with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. Moderate to heavy rainfall of 2 to 3 inches is likely over most of SE AK through the weekend with the exception of the far northern panhandle which will see lesser amounts. This situation will be closely monitored and updates will be sent as conditions change and more information becomes available.
